Articles.Content:
I've been playing KSP since .12. I've landed on the Mun almost exclusively with only 2 manned missions to Minmus. I have never lost a Kerbal.

Now, I've started to become more adventurous and have begun sending probes to other planets.

In my travels, I recently came across an anamoly on the surface of Eve. I've looked at the wiki and searched the forum, but both sources tell me there aren't any easter eggs on Eve.

This may not be an easter egg, per say, but it's still something to look at and I wanted to share it with you all as I've yet to see this posted anywhere.

I present to you, "The Face of Eve!"

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Much like "The Face of Mars," more investigation may be required.
I saw that when I did the Eve Circumnavigation Challenge recently, but not from that angle. It looks like a Pac Man ghost.

"Welcoooome!"

And now you know why kerbals don't want to go on Eve.

"She will eat meeeeeeeee! NOOOOOOOOOO!"

btw there is already a "face of mars" in KSP, it's the "face of Duna"

Eve welcomes you!

Oh by the way, good luck leaving

It's very likely that that's not an easter egg, just a HUGE geological feature that somewhat resembles a face. I made a somewhat similar thread a while back on a possible face(s) easter egg on Dres, but that was quickly shot down due to me just seeing faces where they're not (pareidolia).

EDIT: If you happen to spot a flickering pixel though, deorbit IMMEDIATELY to check it out. Seeing as though we think that new easter eggs haven't been added in a while, a new find would certainly reinvigorate the search for them.

Edited July 10, 2014 by turkwinif

pareidolia much

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pareidolia

oh, learned something new

Mars, the happiest place in our solar system

Edited July 10, 2014 by WooDzor
Funny, looks like its "right arm" is flipping us the bird. Anyone else see that?

It's just a coincidence.

By the way, eve is a terrible place to start with for landings outside of Kerbin SOI. Duna is a better choice. While not impossible, it's very difficult to leave the surface of Eve.

pareidolia much

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pareidolia

Definitely. However, still an awesome find, thanks for sharing. Kinda makes me wanna go find it now

It's just a coincidence.

By the way, eve is a terrible place to start with for landings outside of Kerbin SOI. Duna is a better choice. While not impossible, it's very difficult to leave the surface of Eve.

I'm not landing there. I've only JUST begun traveling to other planets at the moment. For now, I'm just sending camera probes to snap awesome pictures for the boys in the lab to drool over.

Eve is easy to land on with its thick atmosphere, it was my first manned planet landing.

It's just hard to take off from.

The "Dudly Kerman Eve Visitor" has now been renamed to the "Dudly Kerman Permanent Eve Base".

The "Dudly Kerman Eve Visitor" has now been renamed to the "Dudly Kerman Permanent Eve Base".

Poor Dudly lol
I guess one could say it looks very... evil.
